com.github.dm.jrt.android.channel

Class ParcelableByteChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.android.channel.ParcelableByteChannel

  • public class ParcelableByteChannel
extends Object
    Utility class focused on the optimization of the transfer of byte chunks through routine channels.

    For example, an invocation writing bytes can be implemented as: 

         

         public void onInput(final IN in,
                 final ResultChannel<ParcelableByteBuffer> result) {

             ...
             final BufferOutputStream outputStream =
                     ParcelableByteChannel.byteChannel().bind(result);
             ...
         }
    While an invocation reading them: 
         

         public void onInput(final ParcelableByteBuffer buffer,
                 final ResultChannel<OUT> result) {

             ...
             final BufferInputStream inputStream =
                     ParcelableByteChannel.inputStream(buffer);
             ...
         }
    The generated buffers implement the parcelable interface.
    Note that the streams used to write into and read from buffers should be properly closed as the Java best practices suggest.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 09/03/2015.

      Nested Classes

      static class  ParcelableByteChannel.ParcelableByteBuffer
      Parcelable buffer of bytes.

      static ParcelableByteChannel byteChannel()
      Returns a new byte channel.
      static ParcelableByteChannel byteChannel(int dataBufferSize)
      Returns a new byte channel.
      Since the byte buffers generated by the channel are likely to be part of a remote procedure call, be aware of the limits imposed by the Android OS architecture when choosing a specific buffer size (see TransactionTooLargeException).

      Returns a new byte channel.

    • Method Detail

      • byteChannel

        @NotNull
public static ParcelableByteChannel byteChannel()
        Returns a new byte channel.
        Returns:
        the byte channel.

      • byteChannel

        @NotNull
public static ParcelableByteChannel byteChannel(int dataBufferSize)
        Returns a new byte channel.
        Since the byte buffers generated by the channel are likely to be part of a remote procedure call, be aware of the limits imposed by the Android OS architecture when choosing a specific buffer size (see TransactionTooLargeException).
        Parameters:
        dataBufferSize - the size of the data buffer used to transfer the bytes through the routine channels.
        Returns:
        the byte channel.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified size is 0 or negative.

      • byteChannel

        @NotNull
public static ParcelableByteChannel byteChannel(int dataBufferSize,
                                        int corePoolSize)
        Returns a new byte channel.
        Since the byte buffers generated by the channel are likely to be part of a remote procedure call, be aware of the limits imposed by the Android OS architecture when choosing a specific buffer size (see TransactionTooLargeException).
        Parameters:
        dataBufferSize - the size of the data buffer used to transfer the bytes through the routine channels.
        corePoolSize - the maximum number of data retained in the pool. Additional data created to fulfill the bytes requirement will be discarded.
        Returns:
        the byte channel.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified size is 0 or negative.

      • inputStream

        @NotNull
public static ByteChannel.BufferInputStream inputStream(@NotNull
                                                ParcelableByteChannel.ParcelableByteBuffer buffer)
        Creates an input stream returning the data contained in the specified buffer.

        Note that only one input stream can be created for each buffer.

        Parameters:
        buffer - the byte buffer.
        Returns:
        the input stream.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an input stream has been already created for the specified buffer.

      • inputStream

        @NotNull
public static ByteChannel.BufferInputStream inputStream(@NotNull
                                                ParcelableByteChannel.ParcelableByteBuffer... buffers)
        Creates an input stream returning the concatenation of the data contained in the specified buffers.

        Note that only one input stream can be created for each buffer.

        Parameters:
        buffers - the byte buffers whose data have to be concatenated.
        Returns:
        the input stream.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an input stream has been already created for one of the specified buffers.

      • bind

        @NotNull
public ByteChannel.BufferOutputStream bind(@NotNull
                                          IOChannel<? super ParcelableByteChannel.ParcelableByteBuffer> channel)
        Returns the output stream used to write bytes into the specified channel.

        Note that the channel will be automatically closed as soon as the returned output stream is closed.

        Parameters:
        channel - the I/O channel to which pass the data.
        Returns:
        the output stream.
